name: Drinking in Season: Cranberry Crush
description: With December creeping in we're about to get into serious winter weather—you know, cold, snowy, let's-stay-inside kind of weather. This is when I reach for the warming whiskey. But just because you're stuck inside doesn't mean you shouldn't do it up.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the cinnamon syrup: combine 1 cup water and 1 cup sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Add 2 cinnamon sticks and simmer for about 10-12 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain out the cinnamon sticks and store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.
To make the cocktail: Combine the cranberries, cinnamon syrup, orange juice, 1 orange peel and bitters in a cocktail shaker. Firmly muddle the cranberries 10-12 times until fully disintegrated.
Add whiskey and fill the shaker with ice. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds.
Add one ice cube to a rocks glass and strain cocktail into it. Garnish with remaining orange peel.
